steps: Check the scene for safety and ensure it is safe to approach the person in need.
Tap the person and shout to check for responsiveness. If unresponsive, call for emergency medical help.
If the person is not breathing or only gasping, begin CPR immediately.
Position the person on their back on a firm, flat surface.
Place the heel of one hand on the center of the chest and the other hand on top. Interlace your fingers.
Push hard and fast, at least 2 inches deep, at a rate of 100 to 120 compressions per minute. Allow the chest to recoil completely after each compression.
After 30 compressions, give 2 rescue breaths. Tilt the head back, lift the chin, and seal your mouth over the person's mouth. Pinch the nose and blow until the chest rises.
Continue cycles of 30 compressions and 2 breaths until professional help arrives or the person starts breathing.
If using an automated external defibrillator (AED) is possible, follow the device instructions and resume CPR after shocks if advised.
